subject: Art
title: Color & Appetite
description: Why red makes you hungry and blue suppresses appetite.

hook.text: McDonald's: red and yellow. Pizza Hut: red. KFC: red. Wendy's: red. Fast food loves red â€” because red genuinely makes you hungrier.

buildup.text: Red and yellow stimulate appetite by triggering excitement and warmth. Red increases heart rate; yellow grabs attention. Together they create urgency: 'Eat now, eat fast.'

discovery.text: Blue suppresses appetite because very few natural foods are blue. Evolutionarily, blue in food signaled mold or poison. Blue plates can actually reduce how much you eat.

twist.text: Green signals freshness and health â€” which is why organic and health food brands love it. Color doesn't just make you hungry; it shapes WHAT you want to eat.

climax.text: Food photographers use warm-toned plates, warm lighting, and warm backgrounds. Cool-toned food photography feels clinical. The temperature of the color palette sells the meal.

punchline.text: Red says 'hungry.' Blue says 'not hungry.' The food industry knows which to use.
